subject: Programming
title: BASIC and Personal Computing
description: A short lesson to help you apply BASIC and Personal Computing.

hook.text: In 1964, most students couldn't touch a computer. Two professors wanted to fix that.

buildup.text: Kemeny and Kurtz created BASIC â€” a simple language anyone could learn in an afternoon.

discovery.text: When home computers arrived in the 1970s, BASIC came built in. Type and it ran.

twist.text: A teenager named Bill Gates wrote his own BASIC interpreter and launched Microsoft.

climax.text: BASIC proved programming didn't require a PhD. It just needed an invitation.

punchline.text: The simplest language launched an empire.
